title: Zeekly tech guest-post blog frontend (landing + blog navigation + themed UI)

requirements.summary: Build a modern, minimal, tech-forward Zeekly landing page with structured blog-style sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage includes a hero section introducing Zeekly as a technology-focused guest post/blog platform
Visual design is consistent across the page: minimal layout, clear typography, tech-forward styling
Homepage contains a structured blog layout section (e.g., featured posts + latest posts) appropriate for guest posting

file_operations.description: Create the root app composition and wire routing to the required landing page and blog pages (home, posts list, post detail).
Create a shared site layout (header/nav + main container + footer) that enforces a minimal, professional publication structure across pages.
Implement a clean top navigation for Zeekly (logo + primary links like Home/Posts) suitable for a tech publication.

Implement the Zeekly landing page: hero section with tech-oriented identity, structured blog section (e.g., featured + latest), and consistent typography/spacing. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Badge/Separator where appropriate) to keep styling cohesive; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable post card for structured blog presentation (title, excerpt, date, categories, author) used across homepage and listing. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Badge/Button) for consistent UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the generated Zeekly wordmark logo asset and wire it into the header/hero branding.
Add the generated abstract minimal tech hero background asset and use it in the homepage hero presentation.

requirements.summary: Add a prominent, native-looking “Lifestyle” CTA button directly after the hero that links to zeekly.co.uk in the same tab.
acceptanceCriteria: A button labeled exactly “Lifestyle” appears directly after the hero section
Clicking the button navigates to https://zeekly.co.uk/ in the same browser tab (no target="_blank")
Button styling matches the site’s modern tech theme and does not resemble an advertisement

file_operations.description: Insert a prominent CTA immediately after the hero: a button labeled exactly “Lifestyle” linking to https://zeekly.co.uk/ in the same tab (no target="_blank"). Use a shadcn-ui Button (or equivalent) styled to feel native and professional; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement blog navigation with posts listing and post detail views, pre-populated with sample tech-focused content.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can browse a list of posts and open a post detail page within the site
The UI includes clear post metadata presentation (e.g., title, excerpt, date, category/section)
Sample posts cover the requested topic areas (innovation, software guides, startups, tech news)

file_operations.description: Create the posts listing page showing a structured list/grid of posts with metadata and clear navigation to detail pages. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Badge, Pagination primitives if available) for cohesive presentation; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the post detail page rendering title, author, publish date, categories, and full article body with readable typographic layout (e.g., Tailwind typography). Use shadcn-ui components where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a sample posts dataset covering: tech articles, digital innovation, software guides, startup insights, and trending technology news. Used as initial/fallback content when backend content is unavailable/empty.
Wire navigation links to the posts listing view and ensure users can reach blog pages from anywhere in the site.
Register routes for posts listing and post detail views and ensure navigation between list and detail is functional.

requirements.summary: Fetch posts and individual post details from the existing backend actor and render them in list + detail views with graceful fallback to sample content.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to fetch a list of posts and fetch a single post by identifier
Frontend loads posts via the backend actor and renders list + detail views
The solution stays within a single Motoko main actor (no additional backend services)

file_operations.description: Create React Query hooks that use the existing actor access (without modifying immutable hooks) to load: all posts, posts by category, post by slug, and post count; include loading/error states and a fallback to sample posts when needed.
Load homepage featured/latest sections from the backend via the new posts hooks; fall back to the sample dataset if the backend returns no posts or fails.
Fetch and render the posts list from the backend actor via the new posts hooks, including empty/loading/error states and fallback sample content.
Fetch and render an individual post by slug from the backend actor; handle not-found by showing a clear in-site message and a link back to the posts list.

requirements.summary: Apply and enforce a consistent, distinctive tech publication theme (colors, typography, spacing) across all Zeekly pages and components.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent design system is evident across navigation, hero, post cards, and post detail layout
Theme avoids default/unstyled appearance and remains clean and professional
Typography hierarchy (headings/body/meta) is clearly defined and consistent

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens and base typography (including shadcn-compatible CSS variables if used) to establish a distinctive tech-forward palette, spacing rhythm, and heading/body/meta hierarchy across the site.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (e.g., font families, typography defaults, and any brand-specific tokens) to support a consistent tech publication look across components and pages.
Ensure consistent layout spacing and max-width/container behavior for reading comfort across home, list, and detail views.

Refine card typography hierarchy (title, excerpt, meta) and category styling to match the Zeekly theme. Use shadcn-ui components as needed; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Apply consistent reading layout and typographic styling (headings, paragraph spacing, meta) aligned with the global theme, keeping the page minimal and professional.
